Gov: Chris Christie, in a radio interview, clarified that he was not raising tolls by 50 percent, and attributed the toll hikes to his predecessor, Jon Corzine.
The toll increases represent the second: part rate increase approved by the New Jersey Turnpike Authority in October 2008.
The toll increase was initially intended: but was redirected to local road and bridge projects and the authority's capital program after the tunnel project was terminated.
